metadata.description:
This is my first drop on Sound.xyz!

I'm so excited to bring my music and world to web3 and give an opportunity to bring fans on as collectors and owners.

This song came from a place of heartbreak and loneliness through the lens of losing a hero. It was written in tears by a fireplace with my co-writer, Jesse Dueck. Both of us had recently lost a meaningful relationship and what started as a conversation of love and loss turned into a song and story about losing someone you can't replace - the Hero.

This is the second single I've released off my forthcoming debut EP "From the Sun". This record was produced and mixed by Will Kubley (PKA: bodyhaunt) and Ethan Roche (Heyboy), and mastered by Chris Gehringer. All sounds and samples created in studio with purpose.

lyrics.text:
A few months till my birthday
I know summers finally done
Novembers come, it’s here to stay
Grey skies and no more sun
There’s no hero of the story
Yeah, this chapters pretty boring
I lost my phone, I wasn’t mad
You’re never texting back
And i’m not looking, flippin back
To pictures where we laughed
There’s no moral of the story
Talking to the ceiling till morning

Oh oh oh, I keep reading the same old page
oh oh oh, my hero come and save the day

I’d move but I’m in a rut
Too deep I still make up
All the things that you would say
If I ever showed up
Like a hero in your story
All my wings on, we’re soaring
Come on back that ship has sailed
She’s with somebody else
This half dream died in a past life
So put it on a shelf
It’s the last line of the story
Close the book now, ignore it

When I close my eyes
Oh I call you mine, forever, forever
Oh I want you back
All the love that we had, forever, forever
When I close my eyes
Oh I’ll call you mine, forever, forever
And I’ll scream it out
Yeah I’ll shout so loud, forever, forever

metadata.name: Hero #1
metadata.title: Hero
